thread.title: Arsenal transfer news and rumours: Lorenzo Insigne to snub Gunners to agree new Napoli deal?
thread.title_full: Arsenal transfer news and rumours: Lorenzo Insigne to snub Gunners to agree new Napoli deal?

author: James Whaling
title: Arsenal transfer news and rumours: Lorenzo Insigne to snub Gunners to agree new Napoli deal?
text:
Who could replace Arsene Wenger at Arsenal? Share this video Watch Next 
“He actually mentioned in talking last night that he’s coming to the end. I’ve never heard him say that. He’s a wonderful man. He looks tired. 
“But he looks winded, like someone who has whacked him in the stomach. I know someone will ask me: ‘do you think he will go at the end of the season?’ I think he will.” Gunners must lay off Ozil, warns Wenger Ozil shakes hands with his boss (Photo: Shaun Botterill) 
Arsene Wenger has urged fans to stop playing the blame game with Mesut Ozil, writes John Cross in the Mirror. 
Germany midfielder Ozil was singled out by Arsenal fans for criticism after the costly defeat at Chelsea last weekend, and his drop in form has been a major concern. 
It is believed some of his team-mates were disappointed with the 28-year-old’s work-rate during the Chelsea game, which saw Alexis Sanchez threw a few strops on the pitch. 
But Wenger says his men must stick together, rather than pick on individuals, before Saturday lunchtime's home match against improving Hull. 
“The team wins and the team loses," he said. "When you win sometimes some players are singled out, as they are treated like exceptional players. But when you don’t do well sometimes they just focus on a little more on the team aspect and not try to blame each other." Read More
